Cause of death to be reported to ANM/MPW/PHC for infant death review. If child is born in less than 35 weeks, pay attention. Report to ANM/PHC for maternal death review. If yes, refer immediately to a hospital. If the mother does not eat full stomach or eat less than 4 times, advise mother to do so. If more than 5 pads, refer the mother to the hospital. Advise the mother to do so, if not being done. Advise the mother to do so, if not being done. Advise mother to feed the baby after every 2 hours. Temperature up to 102°F (38.9°C) - treat with paracetamol, and if the temperature is above it, refer to hospital. If yes, refer the mother to a hospital. If yes, refer the mother to a hospital. Ask the mother to feed the baby more often and counsel her for proper attachment and positioning during breastfeeding. In case of cracked nipples, advise the mother to keep the breast clean and lubricated. If there is pus in the eye then antibiotic ointment can be applied. Refer the baby to Sick New born care unit at the nearest health facility and also conduct extra home visits as per the high risk baby form. If the baby (low birth weight or normal) is not gaining weight then refer to SNCU at the nearest health facility. Advise the mother to provide extra warmth to the baby and feed the baby more frequently. If the baby (low birth weight or normal) is not gaining weight then refer to SNCU at the nearest health facility.

Piramal Swasthya is focusing on bridging the gaps of Public Healthcare by supplementing and complementing Government of India’s vision to meet Universal Health Care for all. Piramal Swasthya is one of the largest not-for-profit organizations in India - in the primary public health care space with a focus on Maternal health, Child and Adolescent Health, Non-communicable diseases. Piramal Swasthya has over a decade-long experience in operating several healthcare innovations at scale, which are addressing the primary health care needs of most underserved and marginalized populations across India. Piramal Swasthya is operational in 20 states in India through 35 innovative public health care delivery programs and has served more than 10.7 Crore beneficiaries thus far, with its services designed to reach the last village and the last household. Piramal Swasthya employs 2260 employees including 250 medical doctors who work around the core value of Seva Bhav (beneficiary-centricity) through an outcome oriented approach. Over the last twelve years, the focus has been on, Building platforms for sustainable impact at scale, Innovations to scale as a journey, Influencing policies, governance, and accountability of the public health care system as a knowledge and implementation partner of the NITI Aayog. Innovation in the form of intervention design, modelling, piloting and scaling-up those pilots has been an approach at Piramal Swasthya. Piramal Swasthya is committed to make primary healthcare not only affordable, accessible and available to all, but also to ensure that it is complete, continuous and comprehensive. Powered By Q - Is this app available offline? \n Yes, once the app is downloaded and login is completed, you can use the app offline to collect the data. Please not for downloading and first login, internet is required. \n\n Q - Is it mandatory to fill all the details? \n No, it is not mandatory to fill all the details. But there are few fields which are marked by asterisk (star-shaped symbol * ) and it is mandatory to fill them otherwise you will not be able submit the details. \n\n Q - What does Sync Back option do? \n On clicking the Sync Back option, the screen will show household pending records, beneficiary pending records, and CBAC records which are not synced. After clicking on OK button all the data which have been collected will be automatically to the server for storage. \n\n Q - What do Sync Status option do? \n On clicking the Sync Status option, it will show records which are synced by the user. \n\n Q - How to navigate to next tab? \n To navigate the next tabs \n 1. You can click on the tab name at the top of the app \n 2. You can swipe the screen and the next tab will appear (Swiping left and right is enabled in the app) \n\n Q - After navigating to the next tab, can we edit the data entered in the previous tabs? \n Yes, you can edit the data entered in any of the previous tabs. Once the data is submitted, you cannot edit it. \n\n Q - How to navigate to Piramal Swasthya site? \n On clicking on Hamburger menu, please click on the \'About Us\' option. On selecting this option, the user will be navigated to the Piramal Swasthya\'s website inside the app. \n\n In case of any doubts and concerns, please write an e-mail to IT SUPPORT TEAM \n it.support@piramalfoundation.org

Hello blank fragment Treat mother to paracetamol. Refer mother to Hospital. advice the mother to keep the baby warm by increasing the room temperature, providing skin to skin contact, putting the baby in a warm bag and frequently feeding the baby. advice the mother to keep the baby warm by increasing the room temperature, providing skin to skin contact, putting the baby in a warm bag and frequently feeding the baby. once the baby is warmer then clothe the baby and place in a pre warmed bed close to the mother. then look for signs of sepsis. In case signs of sepsis are not present manage only with 1/4th of a spoon of paracetamol and immediately refer to the SNCU at the nearest health facility.
